title: GeoLocator Model
description: I developed a sophisticated GeoLocator model that uses advanced algorithms to pinpoint a user's location with high accuracy. This model integrates various geospatial data sources and machine learning techniques to ensure precise geolocation, even in challenging environments. The application is highly customizable and can be adapted for various use cases, from mobile apps to large-scale enterprise solutions. It’s designed to be scalable, efficient, and easy to integrate into existing systems, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to implement geolocation services in their project.

title: Really Bad Chess Bot
description: This project revolves around building an AI chess bot that, while far from perfect, adds an element of challenge and fun to the game of chess. The bot is based on a simple minimax algorithm with some tweaks to increase its unpredictability and personality. While it can’t beat grandmasters, it’s surprisingly competent at the basic and intermediate levels of play. I designed it to be a playful project, focusing more on the implementation of AI techniques and game mechanics rather than achieving the best possible chess strategy. The goal was to create a bot that behaves more like a quirky opponent rather than a flawless machine.

title: IT work, MSP Contracting
description: In my role as an IT consultant and MSP contractor, I’ve had the opportunity to work on a wide range of projects, including cloud migrations, IT infrastructure design, and cost-cutting strategies for businesses. My work often revolves around improving system efficiencies, reducing overhead, and ensuring clients have robust, scalable IT solutions in place. One of my major projects involved leading a large-scale migration to Azure for a multinational company, helping them save millions in infrastructure costs while increasing operational flexibility. I’ve also assisted clients in optimizing their software and hardware environments to improve overall performance and security. The work is varied, but every project presents new challenges that require innovative solutions.

title: Upload a Model!
description: This project centers around building a platform for uploading and managing machine learning models in a seamless and user-friendly manner. The goal was to create a system where users can easily upload, store, and deploy their models to a cloud-based environment, ensuring compatibility across different machine learning frameworks. The project also includes features like version control for models, collaborative tools for teams to work together, and automated testing and deployment pipelines for efficient model updates. Whether you’re working on a simple regression model or a complex deep learning model, this platform aims to streamline the process of integrating models into production environments, making machine learning workflows smoother and more efficient.
